channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16289] AsyncProcess stuck messages need to print region/server
item.description:
Fix these out of AsyncProcess...

'2016-07-21 20:16:56.477 o.a.h.h.c.AsyncProcess [INFO] #13, waiting for 25 actions to finish'

They are totally opaque, when you see one, it means a request is ten seconds old at least. It is awkward to do but we should be able to emit region/server.
item.summary: AsyncProcess stuck messages need to print region/server

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I happen to have a patch at hand as a supplement of HBASE-15931, mind if I take this boss? stack

Here's a straight forward patch taking usage of work done in HBASE-15931.

After the patch, logging will look like:

2016-06-23 17:07:18,759 INFO  [Thread-1] client.AsyncProcess$AsyncRequestFutureImpl(1601): #1, waiting for 1  actions to finish on table: DUMMY_TABLE

2016-06-23 17:07:18,759 INFO  [Thread-1] client.AsyncProcess(1720): Left over 1 task(s) are processed on server(s): [s1:1,1,1]

2016-06-23 17:07:18,759 INFO  [Thread-1] client.AsyncProcess(1728): Regions against which left over task(s) are processed: [DUMMY_TABLE,DUMMY_BYTES_1,1.3fd12ea80b4df621fb15497ba75f7368.,DUMMY_TABLE,DUMMY_BYTES_2,2.924207e242e313d2e5491c625e0a296e.]

Assigining the JIRA to myself and trigger HadoopQA

stack please let me know if the patch meets your requirement, thanks.

-1 overall

Strange failures of hadoop check, retry HadoopQA

That log emission looks beautiful Yu Li. Is that all it takes? That is much smarter than the way I was trying to go about it (overriding ServiceExecutor..). +1.

What are those hadoop failures about?

Yes sir, taking usage of the already-recorded regions/servers information of ongoing tasks in AsyncProcess makes the logging easier.

I also have no idea about the hadoopcheck failures, and checking the UT result it only ran 115 cases, which is abnormal. Maybe we could wait for the result of next run.
Oh the patch only triggers hbase-client UT so only ran 115 cases, and it seems the new run passes.
+1 for all versions. Will help operators in a big way (I needed this this weekend...)
Sure, let me start committing this now. Thanks for review sir.
stack one question here, that the patch here cooperates HBASE-15931, but 15931 didn't go into branch-1.1/branch-1.2/branch-1.3, mind if I also commit 15931 into these branches?
HBASE-15931 is harmless patch Yu Li I +1'd it over on the issue and marked it operability... Excellent.
Thanks for taking a look sir, will ping in JIRA after I get all in.
Pushed into all branches except for 0.98 since HBASE-15931 already contains this for 0.98.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.3 #797 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.3/797/)
HBASE-16289 AsyncProcess stuck messages need to print region/server (liyu: rev d201860d69697d466d79dcabde6119b08874b044)

  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/AsyncProcess.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.3-IT #768 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.3-IT/768/)
HBASE-16289 AsyncProcess stuck messages need to print region/server (liyu: rev d201860d69697d466d79dcabde6119b08874b044)

  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/AsyncProcess.java

Checking the IT result, the failure happens against JDK7 and from the output we could observed below output:

# There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue.

# Cannot create GC thread. Out of system resources.

# An error report file with more information is saved as:

# /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/HBase-1.3-IT/it.test/IntegrationTestBigLinkedList/jdk/latest1.7/label/yahoo-not-h2/hbase-it/hs_err_pid22165.log

So it should be an env problem, and since test against JDK8 succeeded, the new commit(s) should be OK.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.2 #682 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.2/682/)
HBASE-16289 AsyncProcess stuck messages need to print region/server (liyu: rev 60b02ec2449e1c7793340d9a9811db8cfd9004af)

  • hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/AsyncProcess.java

I used to think that these messages would happen when the jenkins slave had run amok and was filled with zombie processes consuming all resources. I wonder if that the case here. There used to be a printout of processes when a job ran so you could get an idea of the environment. I should add such a thing to yetus @busbey ? In the jenkins UI it also used to show what else was running on the machine. Maybe a neighbour process stole all resources?

But yes, agree, not this patch. Thanks for digging in Yu Li

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Adds logging of region and server. Helpful debugging. Logging now looks like this:
{code}
2016-06-23 17:07:18,759 INFO [Thread-1] client.AsyncProcess$AsyncRequestFutureImpl(1601): #1, waiting for 1 actions to finish on table: DUMMY_TABLE
2016-06-23 17:07:18,759 INFO [Thread-1] client.AsyncProcess(1720): Left over 1 task(s) are processed on server(s): [s1:1,1,1]
2016-06-23 17:07:18,759 INFO [Thread-1] client.AsyncProcess(1728): Regions against which left over task(s) are processed: [DUMMY_TABLE,DUMMY_BYTES_1,1.3fd12ea80b4df621fb15497ba75f7368.,DUMMY_TABLE,DUMMY_BYTES_2,2.924207e242e313d2e5491c625e0a296e.]
{code}
